column2: Expressive middleware for node.js using ES2017 async functions

column5:
test: fix body test (#1375)

Setting body will set the content-length header. Unless the
corresponding number of bytes are sent the response will
be aborted and not emit 'end'.
feat: accept options in the Application constructor (#1372)
docs: parameter of request.get is case-insensitive (#1373)

docs: Update response.socket (#1357)

* docs: Include `dead-horse`'s comment 

https://github.com/koajs/koa/pull/1355#discussion_r302404837

* Update docs/api/response.md

Polish English

Co-Authored-By: Martin Iwanowski <martin@iwanowski.se>

closes #1335

Reviewed by @tolmasky.

close #1174
feat: response.attachment append a parameter: options from contentDisposition (#1240)

docs: Update error-handling.md (#1239)

Docs incorrectly states that exposed errors are being logged by default error listener:
"which simply log the error if error.expose is true"
https://github.com/koajs/koa/blob/master/lib/application.js#L185

fix: pin debug@~3.1.0 avoid deprecated warnning (#1245)

closes https://github.com/koajs/koa/issues/1243
perf: avoid stringify when set header (#1220)
perf: lazy init cookies and ip when first time use it (#1216)

fix: use non deprecated custom inspect (#1198)

Custom inspection with the `inspect` property is deprecated and will
not work in Node.js 11 anymore. This fixes it by using the custom
inspect symbol where existent and falls back to the old style in case
it does not exist.
fix: Throw a TypeError instead of a AssertionError (#1199)

chore: use this.res.socket insteadof this.ctx.req.socket (#1177)

prefer a shorter path to the object

fix tests: remove unnecessary assert doesNotThrow and api calls (#1170)

* tests: fix error verification

So far the error message was not tested at all. This change makes
sure the error will actually be tested for.

* tests: remove unnecessary api calls

`assert.doesNotThrow` does not provide any benefit since it will
only catch errors and then rethrow in case of an error.

Structure of http.ServerResponse._header will change in future
Node versions. Avoid reading and setting it directly when
helpers exist.

JSDoc question/suggestion on optional parameters

Hi, Webstorm keeps giving me warnings on the 'redirect' method, because the JSDoc specified two input parameters, both required. There is a JSDoc standard for optional parameters. What is your view on using these in KOA documentation?

Merge pull request #443 from koajs/fix-query-cache

return same object from request.query

return same object from request.query

Before this change, calling request.query when there was no querystring
resulted in a new object created and returned each time. If the resulting
object was ever changed, accessing request.query would not reflect it and
cause weird bugs.

Merge pull request #133 from jed/patch-1

Update keygrip dependency version

Update keygrip dependency version

The 0.2.4 version of keygrip was problematic for Windows installations, due to the generation of a default secret (jed/keygrip#11). Since generating default keys wasn't a well advised API to begin with, we removed it. The major version was bumped to reflect the breaking change.
